intro: Bunchosia guadalajarensis, commonly known as the Guadalajara bunchosia, is a shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Bunchosia guadalajarensis is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
